Artifacts

  • Blog

  • Skills

Discovering one's strengths is not all that helpful until they are put to use. Knowing a talent exists and not at least considering how it has played a role in my life would negate the purpose of discovering the skill. Thus we must search for areas where our skills have been used. We must find artifacts. Then, we must go out and plant more artifacts, little treasures for those around us to enjoy. Here are some of my artifacts based on my Gallup strengths.

Ideation

A small portion of one of my idea boards on Trello. Many cards can be clicked to reveal a long description with details about the idea.

Strategic

I try to find ways of completing more of my goals. Last year I started using Todoist to track my tasks. In the yearly review I found that I had completed 1449 tasks in 2017, and landed in the top 10% of users.

Achiever

Some of my awards from SCC and TCA displayed on top of the quilt I made for 4H when I was young. I earned a grand champion ribbon for the quilt.

Learner

I helped with almost every step during the building of this barn while I was in Michigan, and I learned so much.

Faith

My faith is important to me. This is a picture of my first Bible, which has been quite worn out from reading.
